assignedChallenge.title: Green Campus Resource Monitor
assignedChallenge.intro: A logging and analytics system for campus electricity/water usage. Helps administrators monitor resource efficiency.
assignedChallenge.req: A logging and analytics system for campus electricity/water usage.
assignedChallenge.output: Weekly efficiency reports, Usage graphs, Alerts for unusual spikes.

assignedChallenge.title: Waste Segregation Tracking App
assignedChallenge.intro: Tracks daily waste categories and predicts monthly trends. Supports zero-waste goals.
assignedChallenge.req: Functions must include: Waste logging, Recyclable percentage calculation, Trend forecasting.

assignedChallenge.title: City Temperature Trend Analyzer
assignedChallenge.intro: A CSV-based analysis tool for climate logs over a decade. Supports urban climate planning.
assignedChallenge.req: Parse large datasets. Detect anomalies like sudden heat-wave spikes. Apply rolling averages OR basic regressions. Optional: simple graph visualizations.

assignedChallenge.title: Smart Irrigation Simulation Model
assignedChallenge.intro: A moisture-aware irrigation optimizer, aligning with smart agriculture.
assignedChallenge.req: Inputs: soil moisture, humidity %, rainfall forecast, crop type.
assignedChallenge.output: Water required per cycle, Alerts for overwatering, A day-by-day irrigation plan.

assignedChallenge.title: Flood Risk Detection Program
assignedChallenge.intro: Risk calculation based on rainfall intensity and terrain data. Helps with early warning systems.
assignedChallenge.output: Colored outputs (Low, Moderate, High, Critical) indicating risk level.

assignedChallenge.title: Forest Fire Early Alert System
assignedChallenge.intro: Predicts fire risk from key weather variables. Highly relevant for dry-season alerts.
assignedChallenge.req: Predicts fire risk from temperature, humidity, and wind speed.
assignedChallenge.output: Fire index, Risk category, Preventive suggestions.

assignedChallenge.title: Climate-Aware Smart Home Scheduler
assignedChallenge.intro: Shifts tasks (laundry, charging, cooling) to low-energy hours. Useful for smart home automation.
assignedChallenge.output: Optimized hourly schedule, Energy saved in $\text{kWh}$.

assignedChallenge.title: Air Quality Index (AQI) Predictor
assignedChallenge.intro: A basic regression Machine Learning (ML) model useful for health and pollution monitoring.
assignedChallenge.req: Restrictions: Only $\text{sklearn}$ basics. Small datasets. Summary of contributing factors.

assignedChallenge.title: Energy-Efficient Path Planner
assignedChallenge.intro: A graph-based route optimization program for eco-routing and smart mobility.
assignedChallenge.req: Input: roads, distances, traffic levels, fuel cost OR EV consumption rates. Weighted graph where edges represent energy usage. Algorithm: Dijkstra, A*, or custom heuristic.

assignedChallenge.title: Carbon Footprint Estimation System
assignedChallenge.intro: Modular Python solution to calculate total $\text{CO}_2$ emissions for individuals/households. Helps users understand and improve eco habits.
assignedChallenge.req: Input modules for transport, appliances, dietary habits, waste, and lifestyle choices. Customizable user profiles (e.g., student, family of four). Dynamic weighting based on organizer data.
assignedChallenge.output: Output graphs OR a summary table showing emission breakdowns.

assignedChallenge.title: Green Campus Resource Monitor
assignedChallenge.intro: A logging and analytics system for campus electricity/water usage. Helps administrators monitor resource efficiency.
assignedChallenge.req: A logging and analytics system for campus electricity/water usage.
assignedChallenge.output: Weekly efficiency reports, Usage graphs, Alerts for unusual spikes.

assignedChallenge.intro: Tracks daily waste categories and predicts monthly trends. Supports zero-waste goals.
assignedChallenge.req: Functions must include: Waste logging, Recyclable percentage calculation, Trend forecasting.

assignedChallenge.req: Parse large datasets. Detect anomalies like sudden heat-wave spikes. Apply rolling averages OR basic regressions. Optional: simple graph visualizations.
